intro: Ayenia lucida, commonly known as white beadweed, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Ayenia lucida is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woods.
